question_text: Which of the following can prevent biometric authentication from functioning properly on a Windows laptop? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Disabled biometric settings in Group Policy
Missing or incorrect driver for the fingerprint sensor
Lack of internet access during login
Use of third-party antivirus blocking device access
correct_answer: Disabled biometric settings in Group Policy
Missing or incorrect driver for the fingerprint sensor
Use of third-party antivirus blocking device access
explanation: Windows policies and missing drivers can block biometric hardware. Security software may also block access to the fingerprint/face hardware. Internet is not required for local login, and mouse settings are unrelated.
